description: A broad survey of Chinese architecture, sculpture, and painting from the Neolithic age through the nineteenth century. Topics include excavated material from China's bronze age, Chinese funerary arts, Buddhist caves and sculpture (including works in the University Museum), the Chinese city, the Chinese garden, and major masterpieces of Chinese painting.
name: THE ARTS OF CHINA

values.comments: Most students found this class to be comprehensive and enjoyable.  Students did enjoy having recitation in the museum, which allowed the class to see objects related to their studies up close.  Some students did caution that knowledge of the Chinese language would have been helpful, and others felt the course moved too quickly.
